channel.title: New car - 2011 Hyundai Elantra Limited
channel.description:
Just got a brand new car (well, really got it 1.5 months ago).
2011 Black on Black Hyundai Elantra Limited + all possible features.
LOVING this car. Beats out all other similar sized sedans in it's range, and then some larger sized sedans. Not to mention, it's been the fastest selling car lately. I've only seen a few on the road though, and they're all the silver GLS model, not too fancy. Also loving my 38+ average MPG. Most features of luxury cars these days: proximity key, push start, backup camera, all heated seats, touch screen nav, for a much smaller price. All for a few grand cheaper than the other cars in it's range.
It's definitely a head-turner.
Thoughts?
[img]http://a7.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-ash4/223284_1794539219549_1121730451_31758850_4443572_n.jpg[/img] [img]http://a5.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-snc6/222099_1794540099571_1121730451_31758858_939225_n.jpg[/img] [img]http://a3.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-snc6/230494_1794540219574_1121730451_31758859_7405256_n.jpg[/img] [img]http://a6.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-ash4/222429_1794540419579_1121730451_31758860_8209603_n.jpg[/img] [img]http://a4.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-snc6/223454_1794540619584_1121730451_31758861_3428989_n.jpg[/img] [img]http://a2.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-ash4/222429_1794540779588_1121730451_31758862_887183_n.jpg[/img] [img]http://a8.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-snc6/230884_1794540939592_1121730451_31758863_1514503_n.jpg[/img] [img]http://a1.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-snc6/228304_1794539419554_1121730451_31758851_4007996_n.jpg[/img] [img]http://a3.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-snc6/226744_1794539499556_1121730451_31758852_1131390_n.jpg[/img]

item.title: New car - 2011 Hyundai Elantra Limited
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Got to around 105mph in my shitty little fiesta doing some A-roads on my way to cornwall. Car started shaking all over the place so copped out going any faster. car was probably close to blowing though

Read full topic

item.title: New car - 2011 Hyundai Elantra Limited
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Fastest I’ve been is 200kmh in my car (which does have 322,000 km on it) on a 2km straight, was still pulling but the corner was approaching fast. Feels like flying, but not as safe.

Still, bigger engine means less wear, means longer lasting… Just more parts to replace when it does give out though.

Read full topic

item.title: New car - 2011 Hyundai Elantra Limited
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:24, topic:394123”][quote author=Radeon link=topic=491309.msg3707876#msg3707876 date=1313160005]
I don’t understand the obsession of having powerful cars, especially come from people like mitb who come out as law abiding citizens. Would you ever exceed the speed limit? Even then, you can still do that in almost any car…
[/quote]

I can fly up hills going the speed limit when other vehicles can barely make it, I can tow things, I can take off quickly when I need to/feel like it. It’s simply more fun to drive.

Also, yes, I’ve exceeded the speed limit. Once on a lonely road in Wyoming where I could see for miles I hit 160mph. Hell, the speed limit out there is 90 or 95mph anyway, most vehicles have a hard time with it too. :D[/quote]
my £250 corsa topped 95, hardly anyone should have a problem reaching that speed limit

Read full topic

item.title: New car - 2011 Hyundai Elantra Limited
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Radeon:

I don’t understand the obsession of having powerful cars, especially come from people like mitb who come out as law abiding citizens. Would you ever exceed the speed limit? Even then, you can still do that in almost any car…

I can fly up hills going the speed limit when other vehicles can barely make it, I can tow things, I can take off quickly when I need to/feel like it. It’s simply more fun to drive.

Also, yes, I’ve exceeded the speed limit. Once on a lonely road in Wyoming where I could see for miles I hit 160mph. Hell, the speed limit out there is 90 or 95mph anyway, most vehicles have a hard time with it too.

Read full topic

item.title: New car - 2011 Hyundai Elantra Limited
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Radeon:

I don’t understand the obsession of having powerful cars, especially come from people like mitb who come out as law abiding citizens. Would you ever exceed the speed limit? Even then, you can still do that in almost any car…

No, but you can spend more than required on pertrol to have a large, loud engine making a lot of noise (but not a lot of power) while it struggles to pull around the big heavy american car.

Off topic: what is your website URL? I want to check your work out.

Looks like a nice car though, well it looks awful actually :o, but it sounds like it will be reliable and good on gas, which are probably the two most important factors when buying a car.

item.title: New car - 2011 Hyundai Elantra Limited
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:15, topic:394123”]25,000 miles is quite used? Really? Seems new to me, in fact it’s barely broken in.

One of my friends bought a brand new Hyundai like this one in 2005, he has put 2 engines in it and it still doesn’t run right. My late 80s and early 90s trucks are still running great though. :)[/quote]

But you have no idea how the owner has taken care of it. It’s not anything against Dodge, or American cars for that matter. We’d be in the same situation if it was a brand new Dodge against a 2005 Hyundai.

You’re thinking of one situation. A couple I’m friends with have a 2004 Sonata, and the husband liked it so much he got a 2007 Sonata (this was back in 2007). They both still have their cars and if it ever comes time, they’re buying another Hyundai. I know quite a few others with older Hyundais that still run fine, no problems actually.

As opposed to my 2000 Grand Cherokee. At this point of 200k miles (I bought it 140k) it’s requiring almost all new parts to keep it running. I’ve spent more money replacing things in it than I did on it when I bought it. 11 years and it’s running like crap.

Yeah, cars last a while if you keep replacing everything in them.

I’ve got 10yr / 7yr warranties on just about everything in the car. No fear of things breaking now.

@Bebe: I will. Pollen season is almost over in GA (where the worst pollen is) and I’ve been cleaning it regularly. Keeping a black car clean isn’t easy lol.

Read full topic

item.title: New car - 2011 Hyundai Elantra Limited
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:15, topic:394123”]25,000 miles is quite used? Really? Seems new to me, in fact it’s barely broken in.

One of my friends bought a brand new Hyundai like this one in 2005, he has put 2 engines in it and it still doesn’t run right. My late 80s and early 90s trucks are still running great though. :)[/quote]Take care of any new or lightly used vehicle and it should last you. American vehicles are not so special, get off your horse.

Also “(425hp/425ft-lbs torque) 6.1L racing engine” is laughable. I guess you Americans will always stick by your old saying “There is no replacement for displacement”. Also that thing weights 1800+ kg, comes with a 5 speed auto, and only a 0-100 km/h of ~5 seconds :rolleyes:. Talk about garbage…

@Op, I personally do not like Hyundai (just a personal preference, I’m sure they’re fine cars) but congratulations on the new car. Take care of it

Read full topic

item.title: New car - 2011 Hyundai Elantra Limited
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Moparisthebest:

You don’t buy a car with a high performance (425hp/425ft-lbs torque) 6.1L racing engine in it for the gas mileage, you buy it for the awesome…

I don’t need performance (and even when I do on the highway, I don’t feel that it’s lacking).

Also, this car is brand new, I’ve put each mile on it myself, and I have warranties out the ass.

Brand new car > quite used car (if price is ~=)

Read full topic

item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Thread is about car, not pictures >_>

@Frell: The DVI Group, check my reel on my site. The really nice looking pieces are stuff I’ve done with them. All the 3D stuff and some 2D. Lots of scripting.

@thepinksock: Taxes included, about 25k. Although, I put about 9k down and pay ~340 a month for 5 years. Although, I pay more than the minimum payment each month so I plan on paying it off earlier.
